alert.note: Alert for Braxton; Calhoun; Clay; Gilmer; Northwest Nicholas; Ritchie; Roane; Wirt (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 5:21PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Calhoun, south central Ritchie, north central Nicholas, southwestern Gilmer, southwestern Braxton, eastern Wirt, eastern Roane and northeastern Clay Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 520 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Glenville to 9 miles west of Gassaway to Birch River. Movement was west at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Grantsville, Birch River, Arnoldsburg, Big Otter, Wallback, Harrison, Nebo, Shock, Millstone, Muddlety, Mount Zion, Ivydale, Big Springs, Brohard, Stumptown, Tanner, Annamoriah, Widen, Strange Creek and Tariff. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 29 and 51. Route 19 between mile markers 48 and 60. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Braxton; Calhoun; Clay; Gilmer; Northwest Nicholas; Ritchie; Roane; Wirt
